result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J Somers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 10/09/17 at 3:00 pm.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Cash bond applied.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No violent contact with the victim.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months, but not before the probation review hearing, upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of DOC.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian J Somers

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for early discharge from probation pursuant to 973.09(3)(d).

Defendant Brian J Somers in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Kim Bridenhagen in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions where matter is at. Agent Bridenhagen indicates ATV wasn't required after assessment, advises defendant has paid financial obligations. Agent Bridenhagen has meeting scheduled for Wednesday with defendant. If meeting goes well, she may be recommending early discharge from probation.  Court won't set another PRH, agent can request hearing if she feels one is needed.

Defendant Brian J Somers in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Victim makes statement to the court. Defense gives sentencing argument regarding the length of defendants probation. Other than length of probation, this is a joint recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect. Probation review hearing set for 10/09/17 at 3:00 pm.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Brian J Somers in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing. Defense asks court to set off sentencing for a couple weeks. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Brian J Somers in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer indicates she was recently appointed to represent defendant, needs some time to discuss case with defendant. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
from Atty Schaefer dated 7/29/16 requesting adjournment of 8/01/16 hearing because of a death in defendant's family. Court reschedules.
Status conference on August 8, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Brian J Somers in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates he will be withdrawing from the case, will have PD office appoint new counsel to represent defendant. Defendant has no objection to Atty Gerbers withdrawing from the case. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brian J Somers in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers feels matter is close to resolving, requests another status in July. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Check #10285

Defendant Brian J Somers in court with along with attorney Shannon Viel who appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Viel appears on behalf of Atty Gerbers requests a 30 day adjournment to allow Atty Gerber a little more time to try and resolve the matter. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brian J Somers in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers has an intvestigator looking into some issues in the case, needs more time to complete that investigation. Atty Gerbers requests another status in 30-45 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Brian J Somers in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers will be meeting with defendant next week to review discovery, requests a status in 30 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
State's Discovery Demand
No violent contact with J.D.

Defendant Brian J Somers in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 12/04/15.  (fingerprint card destroyed 10/06/16)
